str2: Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To carry around; pass: To be driven to and fro. From peri and phero; to convey around, i.e. Transport hither and thither.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) putting to death, (b) dead or lifeless condition. From nekroo; decease; figuratively, impotency.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
